prompt: <description>**Instructions for Part 1:** Construct a rectangular prism with a square base and a square top. The top is offset from the base by a distance equal to the height of the prism. The prism is centered on a vertical axis. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, and 0.0 and a translation vector of 0.0, 0.0, 0.2485. Within this coordinate system, create a face (face\\_1) and a loop (loop\\_1) on that face. The loop contains eight lines (line\\_1 through line\\_8) connecting the following points: * Line 1: (0.0, 0.497) to (0.253, 0.497) * Line 2: (0.253, 0.497) to (0.253, 0.0) * Line 3: (0.253, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.0) * Line 4: (0.75, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.2485) * Line 5: (0.75, 0.2485) to (0.497, 0.2485) * Line 6: (0.497, 0.2485) to (0.497, 0.7454) * Line 7: (0.497, 0.7454) to (0.0, 0.7454) * Line 8: (0.0, 0.7454) to (0.0, 0.497) Scale this sketch by a factor of 0.75. Extrude the scaled sketch along the normal by 0.2485 units and in the opposite direction of the normal by 0 units. This completes part 1 with the following dimensions: * Length: 0.75 * Width: 0.75 * Height: 0.2485 **Instructions for Part 2:** Construct a cylindrical hole in the center of part 1. The diameter of the hole is smaller than the prism, and it is centered on the vertical axis. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, and 180.0 and a translation vector of 0.5015, 0.2485, 0.2485. Within this coordinate system, create a face (face\\_1) and a loop (loop\\_1) on that face. The loop contains four lines (line\\_1 through line\\_4) connecting the following points: * Line 1: (0.0, 0.0) to (0.2485, 0.0) * Line 2: (0.2485, 0.0) to (0.2485, 0.2485) * Line 3: (0.2485, 0.2485) to (0.0, 0.2485) * Line 4: (0.0, 0.2485) to (0.0, 0.0) Scale this sketch by a factor of 0.2485. Extrude the scaled sketch along the normal by 0.2485 units and in the opposite direction of the normal by 0 units. This completes part 2 with the following dimensions: * Length: 0.2485 * Width: 0.2485 * Height: 0.2485 The final shape is a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. The prism has a flat top and bottom. The cylindrical hole is centered and has a smaller diameter than the prism. The prism is white. The cylindrical hole has the following dimensions: * Length: 0.2485 * Diameter: Smaller than the prism</description>

prompt: <description>Construct a long, cylindrical object with a slightly tapered end, featuring a smooth surface and a straight, vertical axis. Begin with the coordinate system. The euler angles are set to -90.0, 0.0, and -90.0, and the translation vector is set to 0.0, 0.0, 0.0. This will define the orientation and location of the first part. Next, create a new sketch (sketch\\_1) on the XY plane of the coordinate system. Within this sketch, create two circles (circle\\_1, circle\\_2) with the following properties: Circle 1: - Center: (0.0176, 0.0176) - Radius: 0.0176 Circle 2: - Center: (0.0176, 0.0176) - Radius: 0.0146 In this sketch, loop\\_1 should consist of circle\\_1, while loop\\_2 should consist of circle\\_2. These loops form the basis for the tapered end of the cylindrical shape. After creating the sketch, scale it using the sketch\\_scale parameter (0.0352). Transform the 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector provided. In this case, the euler angles are the same as those used in the coordinate system, and the translation vector is 0.0, 0.0, 0.0. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with the following properties: - Extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal: 0.75 - Extrude\\_depth\\_opposite\\_normal: 0.0 - Sketch\\_scale: 0.0352 - Operation: Create a new solid body The dimension of part\\_1 should have the following: - Length: 0.75 - Width: 0.0352 - Height: 0.0352 This completes the construction of the first part. Repeat these steps for additional parts, using the information provided in the CAD Assembly JSON. Be sure to follow the instructions provided above, including using clear headings, concise language, and natural descriptions for boolean operations. Always start by describing the shape being constructed, and include the height, width, and length for each intermediate part and the final shape.</description>

<description>Part 1: Curved and Smooth Symmetrical Object Construct the coordinate system Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0228, 0.0237, 0.0] Draw the 2D sketch Create a new 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system created above. Create and constrain the geometry 1. Create an arc with a start point at [0.015, 0.577], mid point at [0.0778, 0.3523], and end point at [0.0172, 0.127]. 2. Create an arc with a start point at [0.0172, 0.127], mid point at [0.0, 0.0009], and end point at [0.1265, 0.0141]. 3. Create an arc with a start point at [0.1265, 0.0141], mid point at [0.3512, 0.0769], and end point at [0.5766, 0.0163]. 4. Create an arc with a start point at [0.5766, 0.0163], mid point at [0.7035, 0.0], and end point at [0.6872, 0.127]. 5. Create an arc with a start point at [0.6872, 0.127], mid point at [0.6266, 0.3523], and end point at [0.6894, 0.577]. 6. Create an arc with a start point at [0.6894, 0.577], mid point at [0.7026, 0.7035], and end point at [0.5766, 0.6863]. 7. Create an arc with a start point at [0.5766, 0.6863], mid point at [0.3512, 0.6257], and end point at [0.1265, 0.6885]. 8. Create an arc with a start point at [0.1265, 0.6885], mid point at [0.0009, 0.7026], and end point at [0.015, 0.577]. Ensure that all loops are closed, and that no part of the sketch intersects itself. Perform the extrusion - Extrude the 2D sketch along the z-axis by 0.0235 units. - Scale the extruded object by a factor of 0.7035. The resulting object represents part 1. Dimensions of the part 1: - length: 0.7035 units - width: 0.7035 units - height: 0.0235 units This completes the instructions for creating part 1. Continue this process for any additional parts in the CAD assembly JSON. Remember to create a new coordinate system for each part. Label each part using the part number provided in the JSON, and ensure that each part's instructions are preceded by the shape and description of the part that is being constructed.</description>

<description>Construct a rectangular prism with a triangular cutout. Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 1 with euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and a translation vector of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0. For sketch face 1, create the following loops and curves: - Loop 1: four straight lines forming a rectangle with start points at [0.0, 0.0], [0.219, 0.0], [0.219, 0.4958], [0.0, 0.4958], and [0.0, 0.0]. - Loop 2: a circle with center at [0.1095, 0.054] and radius of 0.0282. - Loop 3: a circle with center at [0.1095, 0.4414] and radius of 0.0282. For sketch face 2, create loop 1 with four straight lines forming a rectangle with start points at [0.219, 0.0], [0.531, 0.0], [0.531, 0.4958], [0.219, 0.4958], and [0.219, 0.0]. For sketch face 3, create the following loops and curves: - Loop 1: four straight lines forming a rectangle with start points at [0.531, 0.0], [0.75, 0.0], [0.75, 0.4958], [0.531, 0.4958], and [0.531, 0.0]. - Loop 2: a circle with center at [0.6405, 0.054] and radius of 0.0282. - Loop 3: a circle with center at [0.6405, 0.4414] and radius of 0.0282. Extrude face 1 by 0.0917 units, and faces 2 and 3 by the same distance in the opposite direction. Set the sketch scale to 0.75. The final dimensions of this part are approximately 0.75 x 0.75 x 0.0917 units. Create a new coordinate system for part 2 with euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, -90.0 and a translation vector of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0. For sketch face 1, create loop 1 with four straight lines forming a rectangle with start points at [0.0, 0.0], [0.2194, 0.0], [0.2194, 0.0228], [0.0, 0.0228], and [0.0, 0.0]. For sketch face 2, create loop 1 with four straight lines forming a rectangle with start points at [0.1967, 0.0704], [0.5413, 0.0704], [0.5413, 0.0917], [0.1967, 0.0917], and [0.1967, 0.0704]. For sketch face 3, create loop 1 with four straight lines forming a rectangle with start points at [0.5306, 0.0], [0.75, 0.0], [0.75, 0.0228], [0.5306, 0.0228], and [0.5306, 0.0]. Extrude face 1 by 0.0 units, and faces 2 and 3 by 0.5594 units in the opposite direction. Set the sketch scale to 0.75. The final dimensions of this part are approximately 0.75 x 0.5594 x 0.75 units. Perform a cut operation with part 2 on part 1 to create the desired triangular cutout. The final shape is a rectangular prism with a triangular cutout.</description>

prompt: <description>**Part 1: Three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and bottom. The front face is angled, creating a sense of depth.** **Coordinate System** Begin by creating a new coordinate system for Part 1 with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] degrees * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] **Sketch** Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. Within this sketch, create face 1 and add the following loops and lines: * **Loop 1:** 1. Line 1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.655, 0.0] 2. Line 2: [0.655, 0.0] to [0.655, 0.2695] 3. Apply the following extrusion properties to the sketch: * Extrude depth towards normal: 0.0936 * Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0 * Operation: New Body Feature **Description** For Part 1, the shape is a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and bottom.
